Help.#cdata: Specifies whether styles used in an HTML document are used in CSS or LateX style files.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that styles are used in CSS or LateX style files.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that styles are not used in CSS or LateX style files.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACTIVELINKCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color that a link in an HTML document changes to after you click it, but before 
the browser opens that file.
Specifies how to handle leading spaces and line breaks in an HTML document.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Prints text with leading spaces and line breaks, in the same manner as the listing output.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Trims leading spaces and ignores line breaks.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR= color] 
    
Specifies the color of the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.

[Syntax: BACKGROUNDIMAGE="string"] 
    
Specifies an image in a table, cell, or graph to use as the background.
Specifies whether an image is repeated horizontally, vertically, both, or not repeated.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the image is repeated both horizontally and vertically.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the image is repeated horizontally.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the image is repeated vertically.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that the image is not repeated.

Help.#cdata: Specifies whether to put a scroll bar in the frame that references the body file.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places a scroll bar in the frame that references the body file.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to put a scroll bar in the frame that references the body file.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places a scroll bar in the frame that references the body file only if needed.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BODYSIZE= dimension | dimension% | *] 
    
Specifies the width of the frame that displays the body file in the HTML frame file.

[Syntax: BORDERBOTTOMCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color of the bottom border of the table.
Specifies the line style of the bottom border of the specified cell.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Dashed line
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Dotted line

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERBOTTOMWIDTH=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the bottom border of the table.

[Syntax: BORDERCOLOR= color] 
    
Specifies the color of the border in a table or cell if the border is just one color.

[Syntax: BORDERCOLORDARK= color] 
    
In a table or cell, specifies the darker color to use in a border that uses two colors to create 
a three-dimensional effect.

[Syntax: BORDERCOLORLIGHT= color] 
    
In a table or cell, specifies the lighter color to use in a border that uses two colors to create 
a three-dimensional effect.

[Syntax: BORDERLEFTCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color of the left border of the table.
Specifies the line style of the left border of the specified cell.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Dashed line
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Dotted line

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERLEFTWIDTH=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the left border of the table.

[Syntax: BORDERRIGHTCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color of the right border of the table.
Specifies the line style of the right border of the selected cell.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Dashed line
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Dotted line

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERRIGHTWIDTH=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the right border of the table.

[Syntax: BORDERTOPCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color of the top border of the table.
Specifies the line style of the top border of the specified cell.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Dashed line
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Dotted line

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERTOPWIDTH=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the top border of the table.

[Syntax: BORDERWIDTH= dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the border of the table.
Specifies the shape of the line at the end of a box whisker.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Serif
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Line

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: CELLPADDING=dimension | dimension%] 
    
Specifies the amount of white space on each of the four sides of the text in a cell in the table.

[Syntax: CELLSPACING=dimension] 
    
Specifies the thickness of the spacing between cells in a table.

[Syntax: CLASS="string"] 
    
Specifies the name of the style sheet class to use in an HTML document for the table or cell.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color of the foreground in tables, cells, or graphs, which is primarily the color of text.
Specifies the characteristics of a box plot connect line.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Median
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Mean

Help.#cdata: Specifies the position, within the frame file, of the frames that display the contents and the page files.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the frames on the left.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the frames on the right.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the frames at the top.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the frames at the bottom.

Help.#cdata: Specifies whether to put a scroll bar in the frames in the frame file that display the contents and the page files.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places a scroll bar in the frames in the frame file that display the contents and the page files.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to put a scroll bar in the frames in the frame file that display the contents and  the page files.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Whether or not to put a scroll bar in the frames in the frame file that display the contents and  the page files should be determined automatically (internally).

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: CONTENTSIZE=dimension | dimension % | *] 
    
Specifies the width of the frames in the frame file that display the contents and the page files.

[Syntax: CONTENTTYPE="string"] 
    
Specifies the value of the content type for pages in an HTML document that is sent directly to a
web server rather than to a file.

[Syntax: CONTRASTCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the alternate colors for maps. The alternate colors are applied to the blocks on region
areas in block maps.

Specifies the alternate colors for maps. The alternate colors are applied to the blocks on region 
areas in block maps.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays caps at the ends of the whiskers.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays the line connecting multiple boxes.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays filled boxes, bars, ellipses, and bands.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Displays the mean symbol within a box.
ToolTips.@ToolTip5: Displays the median line within the box

Help.#cdata: Specifies whether the drop shadow color for text is displayed.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the drop shadow color for text is displayed.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the drop shadow color for text is not displayed.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: ENDCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the final color used with a two or three color ramp.

[Syntax: FILLRULEWIDTH= dimension] 
    
Places a rule of the specified width into the space around the text (or entire cell if there is no text) 
in a table where white space would otherwise appear.

[Syntax: FLYOVER="string"] 
    
Specifies the text to show in a data tip for the cell.

[Syntax: FONT=font-definition] 
    
Specifies a font definition to use in tables, cells, and graphs.

[Syntax: FONTFAMILY="string-1<..., string-n>"] 
    
Specifies the font to use in cells and graphs. If you supply multiple fonts, then the destination 
device uses the first one that is installed on the system.

[Syntax: FONTSIZE=dimension | size] 
    
Specifies the size of the font for tables, cells, and graphs.
Specifies the style of the font for tables, cells, and graphs.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Italic font style
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Roman font style
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: In many cases, slant and italic map to the same font.

Help.#cdata: Specifies the font weight of tables, cells, and graphs.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Medium font weight
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bold font weight

Help.#cdata:
Specifies the font width of tables, cells, and graphs compared to the width of the usual design of 
the table, cell, or graph.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Normal font width
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Compressed font width

Help.#cdata: Specifies the type of frame to use on a table.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border at the top
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border at the bottom
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Borders at the top, bottom, and both sides
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Borders at the top and bottom
ToolTips.@ToolTip5: A border at the left side
ToolTips.@ToolTip6: A border at the right side
ToolTips.@ToolTip8: Borders at the left and right sides

Help.#cdata: Specifies whether to put a border around the frame for an HTML file that uses frames.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places a border around the frame for an HTML file that uses frames.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to put a border around the frame for an HTML file that uses frames.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: FRAMESPACING=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of the space between frames for HTML that uses frames.
Specifies the direction of the gradient.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a vertical gradient.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a horizontal gradient.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: HEIGHT=dimension] 
    
Specifies the height of a cell, graph, or graphics in an HTML document.
Specifies the window or frame in which to open the target of the link.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Opens the target in a new, blank window. The window has no name.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Opens the target in the window from which the current window was opened.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Opens the target in the browser's search pane.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Opens the target in the current window. This is the default.
ToolTips.@ToolTip5: Opens the target in the topmost window.
ToolTips.@ToolTip6: Opens the target in the specified window or the frame.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: HTMLID="string"] 
    
Specifies an ID for the table or cell. The ID is for use by a Java Script.

[Syntax: HTMLSTYLE="string"] 
    
Specifies individual attributes and values for a table or cell in an HTML document.

[Syntax: IMAGE="string"] 
    
Specifies the image to appear in a graph. This image is positioned or tiled.
Specifies the pattern of a line.Valid pattern numbers range from 1 to 46.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Solid
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Solid dash

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: LINETHICKNESS=dimension] 
    
Specifies the thickness of a line.

[Syntax: LINKCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the color for the links in an HTML document that have not yet been visited.

In an HTML document, the LISTENTRYANCHOR= attribute specifies whether to make the entry in the table 
of contents a link to the body file.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to make this entry in the table of contents a link to the body file.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to make this entry in the table of contents a link to the body file.

Help.#cdata:
In an HTML document, the LISTENTRYDBLSPACE= attribute specifies whether to double space between 
entries in the table of contents.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to double space between entries in the table of contents.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to double space between entries in the table of contents.

Help.#cdata: Specifies the string to use for the bullets in the contents file. ODS uses bullets in the contents file.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Circle
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Decimal

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: MARKERSIZE=dimension] 
    
Specifies the marker size (both width and height).
Specifies a marker symbol.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: ArrowDown
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Asterisk

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: MARGINBOTTOM= dimension] 
    
Specifies the bottom margin for the HTML document.

[Syntax: MARGINLEFT=dimension] 
    
Specifies the left margin for the HTML document.

[Syntax: MARGINRIGHT=dimension] 
    
Specifies the right margin for the HTML document.

[Syntax: MARGINTOP= dimension] 
    
Specifies the top margin for the HTML document.

[Syntax: NEUTRALCOLOR=color] 
    
Specifies the middle color in a 3-color ramp.
Specifies how to handle space characters in cells.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Does not let SAS break a line at a space character.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lets SAS break a line at a space character if appropriate.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTPUTHEIGHT=Dimension] 
    
Specifies the height of a graph.

[Syntax: OUTPUTWIDTH=dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of a graph.

[Syntax: OVERHANGFACTOR= nonnegative-number] 
    
Specifies an upper limit for extending the width of the column in an HTML document.

[Syntax: PAGEBREAKHTML= "string"] 
    
Specifies HTML to place at page breaks in an HTML document.

[Syntax: POSTHTML= "string"] 
    
Specifies the HTML code to place after the table or cell.

[Syntax: POSTIMAGE= "string" | fileref] 
    
Specifies an image to place before the table or cell.

[Syntax: POSTTEXT= "string"] 
    
Specifies text to place after the cell or table.

[Syntax: PREHTML="string"] 
    
Specifies the HTML code to place before the table or cell.

[Syntax: PREIMAGE= "string" | fileref] 
    
Specifies an image to place before the table or cell.

[Syntax: PRETEXT="string"] 
    
Specifies text to place before the cell or table.
Specifies how less-than signs (<), greater-than signs (>), and ampersands (&) are interpreted in cells.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Interprets special characters as the characters themselves.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Interprets special characters as markup language tags.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Interprets any string that starts with a < and ends with a > as a markup language tag (ignoring  spaces that immediately precede the <, spaces that immediately follow the >, and spaces at the  beginning and end of the string).

Help.#cdata: Specifies the types of rules to use in tables.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Between all rows and columns
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Between all columns
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Between the table header and the table

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARTCOLOR= color] 
    
Specifies the start fill color for a graph. It is used to create a gradient effect.

[Syntax: TAGATTR="string"] 
    
Specifies text to insert into HTML.

Specifies justification in tables, cells, and graphs. In graphs, this option specifies 
the justification of the image specified with the IMAGE= statement.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies center justification.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies aligning the values by the decimal point.

Help.#cdata: Changes the visual presentation of the text.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the text's visual presentation alternates rapidly between visible and invisible.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that a line is drawn through the text.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that a line is drawn above the text.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that a line is drawn below the text.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: TEXTINDENT=n] 
    
Specifies the number of spaces that the first line of output will be indented.
Specifies the placement of all major and minor axix tick marks.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Inside the axis
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Outside the axis

Help.#cdata: Specifies how to evenly distribute text.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the words will be evenly distributed across the page.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that all characters will be evenly distributed across a page.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRANSPARENCY=dimension] 
    
Specifies a transparency level for graphs. The values are 0.0 (opaque) to 1.0 (transparent).

[Syntax: URL="uniform-resource-locator"] 
    
Specifies a URL to link to from the current cell.
Specifies vertical justification for graphs and cells.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies bottom justification.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies center justification.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: VISITEDLINKCOLOR= color] 
    
Specifies the color for links that have been visited in an HTML document.
Specifies whether to make the image that is specified by BACKGROUNDIMAGE= into a watermark.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to make the image that is specified by BACKGROUNDIMAGE= into a watermark.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to make the image that is specified by BACKGROUNDIMAGE= into a watermark.

Help.#cdata:
[Syntax: WIDTH= dimension] 
    
Specifies the width of a cell, table, line, or a graph. 

dimension is a nonnegative number. 

Restrictions:The HEIGHT= option does not apply to output generated as a result of GRSEG (graph segment) output. 
The WIDTH= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, printer family destinations, and the RTF destination. 

Interaction:The XPIXELS= option in the SAS/GRAPH GOPTIONS statement overrides the WIDTH= attribute. 
Tips:When used with graphs, the HEIGHT=dimension must be specified as a pixel or percentage value. 
If a unit of measure is not specified with the dimension, then the value will be in pixels. If a unit 
of measure other than pixels or percentage is specified with the dimension, then the HEIGHT=dimension 
is not applied to the graph. A column of cells will have the width of the widest cell in the column. 

Use WIDTH=100% to make the table or graph as wide as the window that it is open in.
Specifies the position of the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a BOTTOM position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a BOTTOM_CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a BOTTOM_LEFT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies a BOTTOM_RIGHT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies a CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies a CENTER_BOTTOM position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip7: Specifies a CENTER_CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip8: Specifies a CENTER_LEFT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip9: Specifies a CENTER_RIGHT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip10: Specifies a CENTER_TOP position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip11: Specifies a LEFT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip12: Specifies a LEFT_BOTTOM position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip13: Specifies a LEFT_CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip14: Specifies a LEFT_TOP position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip15: Specifies a RIGHT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip16: Specifies a RIGHT_BOTTOM position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip17: Specifies a RIGHT_CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip18: Specifies a RIGHT_TOP position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip19: Specifies a TOP position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip20: Specifies a TOP_CENTER position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip21: Specifies a TOP_LEFT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.
ToolTips.@ToolTip22: Specifies a TOP_RIGHT position for the background of the tables, cells, or graphs.

Help.#cdata: Specifies whether the border is collapsed or separated.

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the border is collapsed.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the border is separated.

Help.#cdata:
Syntax: PADDING=dimension | dimension% 
    
Specifies the amount of white space between the content of the cell and the border. 

Restriction:The PADDING= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, printer 
family destinations, and the RTF destination.

Syntax: PADDINGBOTTOM=dimension | dimension% 
    
Specifies the amount of white space on the bottom of the content of the cell in the table. 

Default:0 

Restriction:The PADDINGBOTTOM= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, 
printer family destinations, and the RTF destination.

Syntax: PADDINGLEFT=dimension | dimension% 
    
Specifies the amount of white space on the left side of the content of the cell in the table. 

Default:0 

Restriction:The PADDINGLEFT= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, 
printer family destinations, and the RTF destination.

Syntax: PADDINGRIGHT=dimension | dimension% 
    
Specifies the amount of white space on the right side of the content of the cell 
in the table. 

Default:0 

Restriction:The PADDINGRIGHT= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, 
printer family destinations, and the RTF destination.

Syntax: PADDINGTOP=dimension | dimension% 
    
Specifies the amount of white space on the top of the content of the cell in the table. 

Default:0 

Restriction:The PADDINGTOP= attribute is valid only in markup family destinations, 
printer family destinations, and the RTF destination.

Syntax: WHITESPACE=options 

Specifies how the browser handles multiple white space characters and line breaks.

Default:NORMAL

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that white spaces are compressed and text wraps normally.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that white spaces are compressed and that text does not have line breaks.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that white spaces are left intact and that text does not have line breaks.
ToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that white spaces are compressed, keeps line breaks that are in the text,  and adds line breaks as needed.
ToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies that white spaces are left intact and allows line breaking.
